ComicInfo.Title: A Jamaican Bride; Door of Deception or... Right to Lie!; Die Fledermaus; If This is the Answer, What is the Question?; Kaleidoscope View; On Being Too Intense; The Frank Torque Show; Somethin's Rotten in Nutley; Baby Bastard; Dr. Fuzz; The Young and the Frustrated; Hush, Hush, Mrs. Pombladt; The Ad Lib; Girls! Girls! Girls!; Meat Market Year 2050
ComicInfo.Summary:
An old woman prepares a virgin for her wedding night in this tale adapted from Hurston's book "Tell My Horse."
What happened to the narrator when she went to the "Free Pregnancy Test Center" after she suspected she was pregnant.
A relationship that goes downhill quickly from the moment the couple met.
Comparison and contrast between the C.E.O., his secretary mistress, and his wife.
The reasons a male partner broke up with his girlfriend.
Frank hosts on his talk show a man made to like the grunt work no one else wants to do.
A neighbor who exposed himself inside his window.
A baby who is already acting like a bastard.
A doctor who takes sexual advantage of his patient.
Calling a phone sex line in order to lose weight.
Accidental exposure on a TV program.
How Joyce and the neighborhood girls got around to putting on a strip show.
The dating scene in the year 2050.
